summary: Michael Ewing was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, salary, and pay during that period, indicating his involvement in the committee's operations during that time. The specific role or responsibilities of Michael Ewing within the SCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll suggests he was a staff member contributing to the committee's work.
significance: Michael Ewing's significance lies in his employment by the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the exact nature of his work is not specified in the provided documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his contribution to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
